H0.text: Algae are the group of organisms most responsible for changing the composition of Earth's early atmosphere.

H1.text: Fungi are the group of organisms most responsible for changing the composition of Earth's early atmosphere.

H2.text: Reptiles are the group of organisms most responsible for changing the composition of Earth's early atmosphere.

H3.text: Angiosperms are the group of organisms most responsible for changing the composition of Earth's early atmosphere.

A4.text: Cyanobacteria's informal common name is blueâ€‘green algae.

A5.text: Cyanobacteria are probably the most numerous taxon to have ever existed on Earth and the first organisms known to have produced oxygen.

A6.text: Prokaryotic algae, i.e., cyanobacteria, are the only group of organisms where oxygenic photosynthesis has evolved.

A7.text: The oldest undisputed fossil evidence of cyanobacteria is dated at 2100 million years ago, although stromatolites, associated with cyanobacterial biofilms, appear as early as 3500 million years ago in the fossil record.
